member.name: F:BattleForm.clsAttack.typematrix
member.summary: This is a numerical representation of the attack matrix from the Edjipedia. The damage is either half, full, or double depending on the types of the attacker and defender.

member.name: M:BattleForm.clsAttack.Attack(BattleForm.clsBattle.type,BattleForm.clsBattle.type,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.returns: Amount of HP lost to defender. A negative number signifies Attacker's loss.

member.name: M:BattleForm.frmBattle.Cycle(BattleForm.clsEdjimon,BattleForm.clsEdjimon,System.Int32)
member.summary: Represents a turn in battle.
member.param: What number move the player is using. ?CHECK THIS?

member.name: F:BattleForm.frmBattle.components
member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: M:BattleForm.frmBattle.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BattleForm.frmBattle.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: T:BattleForm.clsBattle
member.summary: Represents an encounter with an opponent, a battle with either a trainer or wild Edjimon.

member.name: T:BattleForm.clsBattle.type
member.summary: The type of the Edjimon dictates abilities and defenses.

member.name: T:BattleForm.clsCollision
member.summary: The only real physics in this game is checking for a 2-D collision.

member.name: T:BattleForm.clsEdjimon
member.summary: Represents the creature, "Edjimon". This creature has stats dictating its abilities, hit points, speed, etc.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.arraypos
member.summary: Internal variable that specifies 0-5, where the Edjimon lies in the clsTrainer array. It is used in frmBattle when saving the information back to the game copy of the Edjimon.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.rarity
member.summary: The number represents the odds of seeing the Edjimon in the wild. 1: 89% 2: 10% 3: 1%

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.experience
member.summary: Experience points add up so an Edjimon may increase in level and therefore their stats increase.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.minlevel
member.summary: Used for wild Edjimon. Dictates lowest level that can be encountered on that map.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.maxlevel
member.summary: Used for wild Edjimon. Dictates highest level that can be encountered on that map.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.currentlevel
member.summary: The current level of the Edjimon. The level dictates the stats.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.maxHP
member.summary: If the Edjimon's HP is full, this is what it will be. This increases with level.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.currentHP
member.summary: The current HP. This increases with level.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.attack
member.summary: The attack rating calculated by a formula based on level. This increases with level.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.defense
member.summary: The defense rating calculated by a formula based on level. This increases with level.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.speed
member.summary: The speed rating calculated by a formula based on level. This determines who goes first in a battle. This increases with level.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.accuracy
member.summary: The accuracy rating calculated by a formula based on level. The higher the rating, the less likely the Edjimon is to miss his opponent. This increases with level.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.levelup
member.summary: Contains the experience points required to level up. The index equals the level and the value is the requirement for that level.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.cel
member.summary: The evasiveness rating calculated by a formula based on level. The higher the rating, the less likely the Edjimon is to miss his opponent. This increases with level.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.pics
member.summary: Contains the pictures for the battle screen.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.name
member.summary: The actual name of the Edjimon as prescribed by the Edjidex.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.nickname
member.summary: The user-defined nickname. This is not used for wild edjimon.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.number
member.summary: The Edjidex-prescribed number for the Edjimon. It is a string so that it stays at 3 digits at all times.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.type
member.summary: Edjimon have strengths and weaknesses based upon the attack type or Edjimon type.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.attack_types
member.summary: Defines the type of each of the attacks.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.attacks
member.summary: The names of the attacks.

member.name: M:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a specific edjimon.
member.param: Pass the number of the Edjimon so the information can be read from a .edjimon file.

member.name: M:BattleForm.clsEdjimon.#ctor
member.summary: Create an edjimon.

member.name: T:BattleForm.clsEvent
member.summary: Represents an event in the game, such as changing maps or a battle.

member.name: F:BattleForm.clsEvent.oldpos
member.summary: Contains the position the sprite is moving from

member.name: T:BattleForm.clsLevel
member.summary: LVL file format: mapfile.map tilesetName PlayerStartTileX,PlayerStartTileY NPCs:2 NPC_1_name, folderOfImages, x,y, direction, dialoguelocation NPC_2_name, folderOfImages, x,y, direction, dialoguelocation

member.name: T:BattleForm.clsMap
member.summary: This class is the physical map you walk on. It reads the map files to find tiles and reads information regarding whether or not a tile is passable.

member.name: M:BattleForm.clsSprite.#ctor(System.String,System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Creates a new sprite with the ability to move and animate.
member.param: The name of the sprite to be created.

member.name: M:BattleForm.clsSprite.Animate
member.summary: Cycle through frames in the sprite.

member.summary: Gives us a black background when the method is empty
